revised_title: Lunar Diurnal Variation of Magnetic Declination at the Magnetic Equator
tldr: The author examines the lunar diurnal variation of magnetic declination at the magnetic equator and discusses the methods used to obtain accurate results. They highlight the importance of considering irregularities and the need to include all observations in the analysis. The study focuses on hourly observations made at the Trivandrum Observatory between 1854 and 1858.
